author: @kwtx
title: Killeen police arrest suspect in 2023 fatal hit and run
text: Killeen police arrest suspect in 2023 fatal hit and run BRYAN, Texas (KWTX) - The Killeen Police Department has arrested a suspect involved in a 2023 fatal hit and run. Kristopher Taylor Jr., 47, was arrested and charged with collision involving death, a second-degree felony. On June 11, 2023, at around 2:30 a.m., police were sent to the 1900 block of East Elms Road on reports of a crash. When officers arrived on scene, police say paramedics were helping a man lying in the road with serious injuries. Police say the injured man, identified as Eric Rucker, would die due to his injuries. A preliminary investigation by police showed that two motorcyclists were driving westbound on East Elms Road when Rucker dropped an item in the roadway. Police say both motorcyclists stopped their vehicles and got off their motorcycles to get the item when Rucker was struck by a passing vehicle. A joint investigation with the Fort Cavazos Criminal Investigation Division helped investigators identify Taylor as the suspect in the case. On June 13, 2024, authorities found Taylor in Bryan and arrested him. Taylor was taken to the Brazos County Jail where he is pending arraignment. Copyright 2024 KWTX. All rights reserved.

author: Michael Cusanelli
title: Feeding Champlain Valley uses mobile food truck to help locals with food insecurity
text:
Feeding Champlain Valley uses Good Food Truck to help locals with food insecurity
The nonprofit organization Feeding Champlain Valley is working to maintain its presence in Burlington despite its primary location being under construction.
In addition to opening a location at the O'Brien Community Center in Winooski, the organization is also operating a weekly free food truck with a rotating menu.
The endeavor, called the Good Food Truck, is located on Pearl Street near North Winooski Avenue in Burlington.
Feeding Champlain Valley said it is committed to meeting people where they are located, and in offering free hot meals to those who need them.
"It is really important to have food access, at all times, regardless of if there's construction, a blizzard," said Justin Pflanzaer, the culinary manager of Feeding Champlain Valley. "People deserve the right to a hot meal. So this is our way of providing that to the community during construction."
The Good Food Truck is open from 10a.m. to noon every Wednesday. As for the food shelf itself, the satellite location in Winooski is open Monday through Friday from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.
